nodes.text: A Chagrian female, the mother of Fideltin Rusk lived in a colony of pacifists on the planet Mindor during the Great Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the Sith Empire, but she and her husband were killed in an Imperial attack in 3651 BBY.

The mother of Fideltin Rusk was a Chagrian female who lived on the planet Mindor during and before the Great Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the Sith Empire. A pacifist like her husband and the rest of the Chagrian colony on Mindor, the woman married her husband sometime before the year 3680 BBY, when she gave birth to their son Fideltin. However, her son rebelled against the colony's pacifism and enlisted in the Republic Military as soon as he was of age, and Rusk did not return home for the rest of the Great Galactic War and the subsequent Cold War. The colony was attacked in 3651 BBY by the Empire during an incursion into Republic space, and Rusk's mother was killed along with the rest of the colony.

The mother of Fideltin Rusk, a companion character for the Jedi Knight class in the BioWare video game Star Wars: The Old Republic, was first mentioned in the Holonet section of the game's official site in Rusk's entry. Rusk also mentions his family and their fates within The Old Republic, during the conversation "Passive Resistance," and the family receives another mention in Rusk's entry in the in-game Codex.
